member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid
member.summary: A UniformGrid implementation for Silverlight that arranges children in a grid with all equal cell sizes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of UniformGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.FirstColumnProperty
member.summary: The FirstColumnProperty dependency property.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.ColumnsProperty
member.summary: DependencyProperty for the Columns property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.OnIntegerDependencyPropertyChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Validate the new property value and silently revert if the new value is not appropriate. Used in place of WPF value coercian by the dependency properties in UniformGrid.
member.param: The dependency object.
The dependency property.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.RowsProperty
member.summary: The Rows DependencyProperty.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Compute the desired size of the UniformGrid by measuring all of the children with a constraint equal to a cell's portion of the given constraint. The maximum child width and maximum child height are tracked, and then the desired size is computed by multiplying these maximums by the row and column count.
member.param: The size constraint.
member.returns: Returns the desired size.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Arrange the children of the UniformGrid by distributing space evenly among the children, making each child the size equal to a cell portion of the arrangeSize parameter.
member.param: The arrange size.
member.returns: Returns the updated Size.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.UpdateComputedValues
member.summary: If the Rows or Columns values are set to 0, dynamically compute the values based on the actual number of non-collapsed children.
member.remarks: In the case when both Rows and Columns are set to 0, the Rows and Columns will be equal, laying out a square grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.ComputedRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed row value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.ComputedColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed column value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.FirstColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of first columns to leave blank.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns in the grid. A value of zero indicates that the count should be dynamically computed based on the number of rows and the number of non-collapsed children in the grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformGrid.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows in the grid. A value of zero indicates that the row count should be dynamically computed based on the number of columns and the number of non-collapsed children in the grid.

member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "measure" pass of Silverlight layout. Classes can override this method to define their own measure pass behavior.
member.param: The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child object allotted sizes.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformTimeSlotPanel
member.summary: A UniformWrapPanel behaves similar to an horizontal WrapPanel that places the items in a "vertical first" approach and tries to keep all columns with the same number of items.
member.remarks: If given Infinite width, the UniformWrapPanel will layout in a single column to avoid an horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformTimeSlotPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformTimeSlotPanel.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, measures the size in layout required for child elements and determines a size for the -derived class.
member.param: The available size that this element can give to child elements. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the element will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this element determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child element sizes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Schedule.UniformTimeSlotPanel.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, positions child elements and determines a size for a derived class.
member.param: The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used.
